itemDescription: Scottish rugby union footballer and coach

wikipedia_page.main: Karen Ross Findlay (born 1968) is a Scottish rugby coach and former international player who played for the Scotland women's national rugby union team. She coaches Harlequins Ladies who compete in the Women's Premiership. She won 85 caps for Scotland and captained the side 52 times. She is a Chief Superintendent with the Metropolitan Police.

response: Richmond Women have been coached by Scotland women's national rugby union team coach, Karen Findlay. Richmond women have had 118 international players play for them, including 18 in 2001. Amber Reed, Emma Croker and Rebecca Essex all played for Richmond Women before going on to play for the England women's national rugby union team.
